subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in his own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Carroll County.

section.text: At its first meeting on or after the first Monday in December, the county board shall elect a president and vice president from among its members.

subsection.text: The president of the county board is entitled to receive $7,500 annually as compensation and the other members are entitled to receive $6,500 each annually as compensation.
The compensation of the president and the members described in subsection (a) of this section shall be paid in four equal quarterly installments.
All actions of the county board shall be taken after a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.

This section does not prohibit the county board from meeting and deliberating in executive session, provided that all action is taken after a public meeting and the record of the meeting and all action is made public.
The Cecil County Board consists of six members as follows:

paragraph.text: One voting member elected from each of the five commissioner districts; and
One nonvoting student member.

subsection.text: The five voting members of the county board shall be elected at a general election as required by subsection (c) of this section.

paragraph.text: A member from a county commissioner district shall be a resident of the district.
A member from a county commissioner district who no longer resides in the district may not continue as a member of the county board.
A candidate elected to the county board shall be a registered voter and resident of Cecil County for at least 3 years.

Except as provided under subsection (e) of this section, each voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on the first Monday in December after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
A voting member may not serve for more than two terms.
The Governor shall appoint a new member to fill any vacancy on the county board for the remainder of that term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.

subsection.text: The terms of the voting members are staggered as follows:

paragraph.text: Members of the county board from commissioner districts 3, 4, and 5 shall be elected at the 2006 general election and every 4 years thereafter; and
Members of the county board from commissioner districts 1 and 2 shall be elected at the 2008 general election and every 4 years thereafter.
The student member shall:

subparagraph.text: Be an eleventh or twelfth grade student in the Cecil County public school system elected by the high school students of the county in accordance with procedures established by the school system;
Serve for 1 year beginning on July 1 after the election of the member;
Be a nonvoting member; and
Advise the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students.

paragraph.text: Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session.

subsection.text: The State Board may remove a member of the county board for any of the following reasons:

paragraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency;
Willful neglect of duty; or
Failure to attend, without good cause, at least 75% of the scheduled meetings of the county board in any 1 calendar year.

subsection.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against the member and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

paragraph.text: The State Board shall promptly hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person, or by counsel.

subsection.text: A member removed under this section has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Cecil County.
At its first meeting in December of each year, the county board shall elect a president and vice president from among the board members.
The county board shall meet at least once each month.
The president of the county board is entitled to receive $4,000 annually as compensation and the other voting members are entitled to receive $3,500 each annually as compensation.
The president of the county board and other members are entitled to reimbursement not to exceed $1,000 a year for travel and other expenses.
The Cecil County Commissioners may increase the annual salary of the county board.
The Charles County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: Seven voting members; and
One nonvoting student member.

subsection.text: An individual nominated for a voting membership on the county board shall be a resident and registered voter of Charles County. Any member who no longer resides in Charles County or who is not a registered voter of Charles County may not continue as a voting member of the board.
All voting members of the Charles County Board shall be elected:

paragraph.text: At a general election as required by subsection (d) of this section; and
From Charles County at large.

subsection.text: Each voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on the third Monday in December after the gubernatorial election and until a successor is elected and qualifies. If the third Monday in December is a legal holiday, the term begins on the first day after the third Monday in December that is not a legal holiday.

paragraph.text: The voting members of the county board shall select a qualified individual to fill any vacancy on the board for the remainder of that term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
An interview of an applicant for a vacancy on the board shall be conducted by the board at a meeting open to the public.

subparagraph.text: The board shall publish a list of the names of the applicants for a vacancy on the board at least 2 weeks before the interview of the first applicant is scheduled to occur.
Public notice of the date, time, and location of each interview shall be published:

sub-subparagraph.text: At least 2 weeks before the interview is scheduled to occur; and
In the same manner as a public notice of a regular meeting of the board is published.

paragraph.text: The board is not required to conduct discussions of the applicants or make the final selection of the voting member at a meeting open to the public.
With the approval of the Governor, the State Board may remove a voting member of the county board for any of the following reasons:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a voting member, the State Board shall send the voting member a copy of the charges pending and give the voting member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the voting member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board shall promptly hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the voting member a notice of the hearing; and
The voting member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the voting member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A voting member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Charles County.
The student member of the Charles County Board shall be an 11th or 12th grade student in the Charles County Public School System.

The student member, and an alternate, shall be selected in accordance with procedures approved by the board. These procedures shall reflect recommendations by and involvement of the Charles County Association of Student Councils.
The term of the student member shall be 1 year.
The student member may not vote, but may indicate a preference for or against any question before the board.

Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session that relates to special education placements, collective bargaining, or hearings held under § 6–202 of this article.
The student member may not receive compensation but, after submitting expense vouchers, may be reimbursed for out–of–pocket expenses incurred in connection with official duties approved by the board.

subsection.text: The county board shall elect a chairman and a vice chairman from among its members at an annual meeting to be held on the second Tuesday in January.
If there is a vacancy in the office of chairman or vice chairman, the county board shall elect a replacement within 30 days after the vacancy occurs.

paragraph.text: The salary of the chairman of the county board is:

subparagraph.text: $3,820 for calendar years 1999 through 2002; and
$5,000 per year beginning January 1, 2003 and for each subsequent year.

paragraph.text: The chairman is entitled, for travel and other expenses, to $1,500 in calendar year 1999 and each subsequent year.
The salary of the vice chairman of the county board is:

subparagraph.text: $3,500 for the calendar years 1999 through 2002; and
$4,000 per year beginning January 1, 2003 and each subsequent year.

paragraph.text: The vice chairman is entitled to $600 each year for travel and other expenses.
The salary of a member of the county board is:

subparagraph.text: $3,185 for the calendar years 1998 through 2002; and
$4,000 per year beginning January 1, 2003 and each subsequent year.

paragraph.text: Each member is entitled to $600 each year for travel and other expenses.

subsection.text: Each salary provided under this section shall be paid on a quarterly basis.
All actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.

This section does not prohibit the county board from meeting and deliberating in executive session, provided that all action of the board, together with the individual vote of each member, is contained in a public record.
The Dorchester County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: Five voting members, elected in accordance with subsection (b) of this section; and
One nonvoting student member from each public high school in the county.
The elected members of the county board shall be elected at the general election.
One member shall be elected from each of the five councilmanic districts only by the voters of that councilmanic district.
A member elected from a councilmanic district shall be a resident of the district.
A member elected or appointed from a councilmanic district who no longer resides in the district may not continue as a member of the county board.
Each voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning at noon on the first Monday in December after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
A voting member may not serve for more than three consecutive terms.

subsection.text: The terms of the voting members are staggered as follows:

paragraph.text: One member elected from each of the councilmanic districts 1, 3, and 5 at the 2004 general election, and every 4 years thereafter; and
One member elected from each of the councilmanic districts 2 and 4 at the 2006 general election, and every 4 years thereafter.
The County Council shall appoint a new member to fill any vacancy on the county board for the remainder of that term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
A resident of the district in which a vacancy exists may apply for appointment by the County Council to fill the vacancy.
The County Council shall adopt rules governing the procedure through which an individual may apply to fill a vacancy on the county board.
Each student member shall:

subparagraph.text: Be a twelfth grade student in the Dorchester County public school system elected by the high school students of the public school that the student attends, in accordance with procedures established by the school system;
Serve for 1 year beginning on July 1 after the election of the member;
Be a nonvoting member; and
Advise the board on the interests of students.

paragraph.text: Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student members may not attend an executive session.

subsection.text: The State Board may remove a member of the county board for any of the following reasons:

paragraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency;
Willful neglect of duty; or
Failure to attend, without good cause:

subparagraph.text: At least 75% of the scheduled meetings of the board in any 1 calendar year; or
Three consecutive scheduled meetings of the board.

subsection.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against the member and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

paragraph.text: The State Board shall promptly hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person, or by counsel.

subsection.text: A member removed under this section has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Dorchester County.

section.text: At its first meeting in December of each year, the county board shall elect a president and a vice president from among its members.

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (b) of this section, the voting members shall receive compensation as set by the County Council.

paragraph.text: The salary of each voting member of the county board shall be at least $3,200.
The salary of the president of the county board shall be at least $3,600.

Each voting member of the county board may be provided health insurance and other fringe benefits regularly provided to employees of the county board under the same terms and conditions extended to other employees of the county board.

A board member’s participation in a benefits program sponsored by the county board under paragraph (1) of this subsection may not be considered compensation for the purposes of calculating compensation under subsection (a) of this section.

subsection.text: The county board shall meet at least once each month.

Except for those actions authorized by subsection (c) of this section, all actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.
The county board may take actions in executive session in accordance with § 10–508 of the State Government Article.
The Frederick County Board consists of eight members as follows:

paragraph.text: Seven members elected from the county at large; and
One nonvoting student member.
A candidate elected to the county board shall be a resident and registered voter of Frederick County.
Any member who no longer resides in the county may not continue as a member of the board.
A voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning the first Tuesday in December after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
Voting members of the Frederick County Board shall be elected as follows:

subparagraph.text: Three members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2000 and every 4 years thereafter; and
Four members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2002 and every 4 years thereafter.

paragraph.text: The terms of voting members are staggered as provided in subsection (c) of this section.
The County Commissioners shall appoint a qualified individual to fill a vacancy on the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The student member shall:

subparagraph.text: Be an eleventh or twelfth grade student in the Frederick County public school system elected by the high school students of the county in accordance with procedures established by the school system;
Serve for 1 year beginning on July 1 after the election of the member;
Be a nonvoting member; and
Advise the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students.

paragraph.text: Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session.
The State Board may remove a voting member of the county board for:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a voting member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against the member and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the voting member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the voting member a notice of the hearing; and
The voting member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A voting member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Frederick County.

section.text: At its first meeting after the first Tuesday in December, the county board shall elect a president from among its members.

subsection.text: The president of the Frederick County Board is entitled to receive $11,000 annually as compensation, and each other voting member of the Frederick County Board is entitled to receive $10,000 annually as compensation.
The president and all other members of the Frederick County Board are entitled to health insurance benefits regularly provided to employees of the Frederick County public school system.
All actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.
The county board may take actions in closed session in accordance with § 10–508 of the State Government Article.

paragraph.text: In this subtitle, “elected member” means a member of the county board elected under subsection (b)(1) or (2) of this section or appointed to fill a vacancy under subsection (e)(3) of this section.
“Elected member” does not include:

subparagraph.text: The Chairman or Vice Chairman of the Board of County Commissioners; or
A student member selected under subsection (f) of this section.

subsection.text: The Garrett County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: One elected member from each county commissioner district;
Two elected members from the county at large;
The Chairman or Vice Chairman of the Board of County Commissioners, who shall be a nonvoting, ex officio member; and
One nonvoting student member.
A candidate from a county commissioner district shall be a resident of that district.
The member from the county at large shall be a resident of the county.
A candidate for the county board shall be a registered voter of the county.

subparagraph.text: A member from a county commissioner district who no longer resides in that district may not continue as a member of the county board.
A member at large who no longer resides in the county may not continue as a member of the county board.

paragraph.text: Elected members of the board shall be elected at a general election as required by subsection (e) of this section.
The student member shall be selected in accordance with subsection (f) of this section.
Each elected member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on January 1 after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The terms for elected members are staggered as required by the terms of the members serving on January 1, 1985.

The County Commissioners shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy in an elected member’s position on the board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.

Each May, the elected members of the county board shall select a student member, and an alternate to serve in the event of a vacancy in the student member’s position, from among candidates recommended by the Garrett County Association of Student Councils.
The term of the student member is 1 year and begins on July 1.
To be considered for the position of student member, or as the alternate for the student member’s position, a student shall:

subparagraph.text: Be a sophomore or junior in high school at the time of applying;
Have attended Garrett County public schools for at least 2 years;
Be in good academic standing and have maintained a grade average of at least 80% during the previous 2 academic years; and
Not have experienced significant attendance or disciplinary problems during the student’s high school career.
The Garrett County Association of Student Councils shall propose procedures governing the selection of candidates for the student member’s position.
The procedures proposed under this paragraph are subject to the approval of the elected members of the board.

The procedures adopted under this paragraph shall provide for the selection of up to four candidates, selected by the Garrett County Association of Student Councils by secret ballot, for the position of student member. The names of the candidates shall be forwarded to the elected members of the county board for final selection of the student member and of an alternate.

paragraph.text: The student member:

subparagraph.text: Shall attend all regular meetings of the county board;
May attend special public meetings of the county board;
Shall attend all meetings of the Garrett County Association of Student Councils; and
Shall continue to meet all the requirements for selection to the student member position.

paragraph.text: The student member may not attend executive sessions of the county board.
The State Board may remove an elected member of the county board for:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in his own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Garrett County.

section.text: At its first meeting at the beginning of each year, the county board shall elect a president and a vice president from among its elected members.
Each elected member of the county board is entitled to:

paragraph.text: The salary set by the County Commissioners in accordance with Chapter 91 of the Public Local Laws of Garrett County; and
Allowances for travel and other expenses as provided in the budget of the county board.

subsection.text: All final actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting. The board shall keep a formal record of each public meeting.
This section does not prohibit the board from meeting and deliberating in executive session provided that all action is taken at a public meeting.

paragraph.text: In this subtitle, “elected member” means a voting member elected under subsection (d) or (e) of this section or a member appointed to an elected position on the Harford County Board of Education under subsection (e)(2) of this section.
“Elected member” does not include a:

subparagraph.text: County superintendent of schools serving as an ex officio member of the county board; or
Student member selected under subsection (f) of this section.

subsection.text: The county board consists of:

paragraph.text: Six elected members;
Three appointed members;
The county superintendent of schools, who is an ex officio nonvoting member; and
One student member.

subparagraph.text: A member from a councilmanic district shall be a resident of that district.
A member from a councilmanic district who no longer resides in that district may not continue as a member of the county board.

paragraph.text: A member of the county board shall be a registered voter of the county for at least 3 years prior to the date of the beginning of the term of office of the member.
Of the nine voting members of the county board elected or appointed under this subsection:

subparagraph.text: One member shall be elected from each of the six councilmanic districts only by the voters of that councilmanic district; and
Three members shall be appointed by the Governor.

paragraph.text: The elected members shall be elected at a general election as required by subsection (e) of this section.
The appointed members shall be appointed, when appropriate, within 90 days of the general election.

Except for the ex officio member and the student member, a member serves for a term of 4 years beginning July 1 after the election or appointment of the member and until a successor is elected or appointed and qualifies.

subparagraph.text: Unless otherwise disqualified under this section, a member of the county board is eligible for reelection or reappointment.
A voting elected member or an appointed member may not serve for more than two consecutive terms as a voting member.

paragraph.text: The Harford County Board of Elections may adopt regulations to implement this subsection.

The Harford County Council shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy of an elected member on the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The Governor shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy of an appointed member of the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
The student member of the county board shall be elected by the high school students of the county in accordance with procedures established by the Harford County public school system.
The student member shall:

subparagraph.text: Be an eleventh or twelfth grade student, in good standing, and regularly enrolled in the Harford County public school system;
Be a student government association representative at the student’s high school;
Serve for 1 year beginning on July 1 after the election of the member;
Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, be a voting member; and
Advise the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students in the Harford County public schools.

Except as otherwise provided in subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph, the student member of the county board has the same rights and privileges as a member appointed or elected under subsection (d) of this section.

Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session of the county board addressing a matter on which a student member is prohibited from voting on under subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph.
The student member shall vote on and participate in all matters except those relating to:

sub-subparagraph.text: Geographical attendance areas under § 4–109 of this article;
Acquisition and disposition of real property and matters pertaining to school construction under § 4–115 of this article;
Employment of architects under § 4–117 of this article;
Donations under § 4–118 of this article;
Condemnation under § 4–119 of this article;
Consolidation of schools and transportation of students under § 4–120 of this article;
Appointment and salary of a county superintendent under §§ 4–201 and 4–202 of this article;
Employee discipline and other appeals under § 4–205(c) of this article;
Budgetary matters under Title 5 of this article;
Appointment and promotion of staff under § 6–201 of this article;
Discipline of certificated staff under § 6–202 of this article;
Collective bargaining for certificated employees under Title 6, Subtitle 4 of this article;
Collective bargaining for noncertificated employees under Title 6, Subtitle 5 of this article;
Student suspension and expulsion under § 7–305 of this article; and
School calendar and curriculum.

subsection.text: Except for the student member, the State Board may remove a voting member of the county board for:

paragraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency;
Willful neglect of duty; or
Failure to attend, without good cause, at least 75% of the scheduled meetings of the county board in any 1 calendar year.

subsection.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges and give the member an opportunity to request a hearing within 10 days.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

paragraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

subsection.text: A member removed under this section has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Harford County.
The county board shall elect a president and vice president from among the voting county board members.
The county board shall elect a president and vice president at its first meeting in July as required to implement the provisions of this section.
The president and vice president shall serve a term of 2 years.
If there is a vacancy in the office of president or vice president, the county board shall fill the vacancy within 30 days after the vacancy occurs.
Each nonstudent member of the Harford County Board is entitled to receive $3,600 annually for travel and other expenses related to the performance of duties as a member of the board.
Payments to a nonstudent member for the expenses described in subsection (a) of this section shall be paid in 12 equal monthly installments.
Subject to the approval of the board, a nonstudent member may be reimbursed for additional travel and other expenses.

paragraph.text: There is a School Shared Space Council in Harford County.
The School Shared Space Council consists of eleven employees of the county appointed by the County Executive for a term coterminous with that of the County Executive as follows:

subparagraph.text: Two from the staff of the county board of education;
One from the administrative staff of the County Executive;
One from the Department of Public Works;
One from the Department of Recreation and Parks;
One from the Committee on Aging;
One from the Health Department;
One from Harford County Community College;
One from the Department of Juvenile Services;
One from the county public libraries; and
One from the Department of Planning.

paragraph.text: In addition to the county employee members, the County Executive shall appoint, upon the recommendation of the County Council, seven county citizen members to the Council as follows:

subparagraph.text: One from each councilmanic district of the county; and
One from the county at large.

paragraph.text: A county employee member of the Council who does not maintain his employment in the county shall be replaced on the Council.
A county citizen member who does not maintain his residence in the county shall be replaced on the Council.

subsection.text: Each citizen member may attend and vote at a Council session.
The Council shall:

paragraph.text: Meet not less than three times a year during each year to compile the number of spaces in the public schools of the county that are not filled and to evaluate the feasibility of the utilization of the spaces by the community and county departments; and
Report its findings and recommendations to the county board of education and the County Executive at least once during the school year.

subsection.text: The County Executive, by executive order, may appoint up to two additional members to the Council from agencies of the county government.

paragraph.text: The Council shall elect a president from among its members.
A quorum is 2/3 of the members appointed.

subsection.text: The Howard County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: Seven elected members; and
One student member.

subsection.text: A candidate who becomes an elected member of the county board shall be a resident and registered voter of Howard County. Any elected member who no longer resides in Howard County may not continue as a member of the board.
The seven elected members of the Howard County Board shall be elected:

paragraph.text: At the general election every 2 years as required by subsection (d) of this section; and
From Howard County at large.

subparagraph.text: The terms of the elected members are staggered as provided in this subsection.
Each term of office begins on the first Monday in December after the election of a member and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The term of office of the member elected at the 2002 election is 4 years.
The successor to this office shall serve for a term of 4 years.
Two members shall be elected at the 2004 election.
The successors to these offices elected at the 2008 election shall serve a term of 4 years.
Five members shall be elected at the 2006 election.
Subject to paragraph (5) of this subsection, the successors to these offices shall be elected at the 2010 election and shall serve for a term of 4 years.
Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, as of the 2006 election, the term of each office is 4 years.

sub-subparagraph.text: At the 2006 election, the individual elected as a member who receives the lowest number of votes among the five members elected in that election shall serve for a term of 2 years.

The successor to the office for the member elected at the 2006 election who receives the lowest number of votes among the five members elected in that election shall be elected at the 2008 election and shall serve for a term of 4 years.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (7) of this subsection and subject to the confirmation of the County Council, the County Executive of Howard County shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy on the county board for the remainder of that term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

If a vacancy occurs before the date that is 1 year following the date of the member’s election, the individual appointed under paragraph (6) of this subsection shall serve only until a successor is elected by the voters at the next general election.
Candidates for the vacated office may be nominated at a primary election in the same manner as for any other position on the Howard County Board.

When more than two members of the county board are to be elected at an election and the terms of the offices to be filled at the election vary, the elected candidates receiving the greater number of votes shall fill the offices with the longer terms.

The candidate receiving the vacated position shall take office on the first Monday in December after the election and shall continue to serve for the remainder of the vacated term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
Except as provided in this subsection, an election to fill a vacancy on the Howard County Board of Education shall be governed by §§ 8–801 through 8–806 of the Election Law Article.
The student member shall be a bona fide resident of Howard County and a regularly enrolled junior or senior year student from a Howard County public high school.
The student member shall serve for a term of 1 year beginning on July 1 after the member’s election, subject to confirmation of the election results by the county board.
The nomination and election process for the student member:

subparagraph.text: Shall be approved by the Howard County Board of Education;
Shall include a provision that provides for the replacement of one or both of the final candidates if one or both of them are unable, ineligible, or disqualified to proceed in the election; and
Shall allow for any student in grades 6 through 11 enrolled in a Howard County public school to vote directly for one of the two student member candidates.

paragraph.text: The student member candidate who receives the second highest number of votes in the direct election:

subparagraph.text: Shall become the alternate student member; and
Shall serve if the student member who is elected is unable, ineligible, or disqualified to complete the student member’s term of office.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraphs (6) and (7) of this subsection, the student member has the same rights and privileges as an elected member.

Unless invited to attend by the affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend a closed session addressing a matter on which a student member is prohibited from voting under paragraph (7) of this subsection.
The student member shall vote on all matters except those relating to:

subparagraph.text: Geographical attendance areas under § 4–109 of this article;
Acquisition and disposition of real property and matters pertaining to school construction under § 4–115 of this article;
Employment of architects under § 4–117 of this article;
Donations under § 4–118 of this article;
Condemnation under § 4–119 of this article;
Consolidation of schools and transportation of students under § 4–120 of this article;
Appointment and salary of a county superintendent under §§ 4–201 and 4–202 of this article;
Employee discipline and other appeals under § 4–205(c) of this article;
Budgetary matters under Title 5 of this article;
Appointment and promotion of staff under § 6–201 of this article;
Discipline of certificated staff under § 6–202 of this article;
Collective bargaining for certificated employees under Title 6, Subtitle 4 of this article;
Collective bargaining for noncertificated employees under Title 6, Subtitle 5 of this article; and
Student suspension and expulsion under § 7–305 of this article.

paragraph.text: The student member may not receive compensation but, after submitting expense vouchers, shall be reimbursed for out–of–pocket expenses incurred in connection with official duties, in accordance with the procedures and regulations established by the county board.

subsection.text: Passage of a motion by the county board requires the affirmative vote of:

paragraph.text: Five members if the student member is authorized to vote; or
Four members if the student member is not authorized to vote.
The State Board may remove a member of the county board for:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against the member and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Howard County.

section.text: At its first meeting in December, the county board shall elect a chairman from among its members.

subsection.text: The chairman of the county board is entitled to receive $14,000 annually as compensation and the other members are entitled to receive $12,000 each annually as compensation.

After submitting vouchers under the rules and regulations adopted by the county board, the chairman and the other members are entitled to receive reimbursement for travel and other expenses as provided in the Howard County budget.

The employer’s share for State retirement and pension contributions made on behalf of the chairman and other board members may not be considered compensation for the purpose of calculating compensation under subsection (a) of this section.

paragraph.text: The chairman and other board members may participate in health insurance and other benefit programs sponsored by the board.

A board member’s participation in a benefit program sponsored by the board under this subsection may not be considered compensation for the purpose of calculating compensation under subsection (a) of this section.
Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, the county board shall meet:

subparagraph.text: At least once each month during the months of July and August; and
At least twice each month during the months of September through June.

paragraph.text: The county board shall meet at least 24 times each year.

subsection.text: Except for those actions authorized by subsection (c) of this section, all actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.
The county board may take actions in closed session in accordance with § 10–508 of the State Government Article, including action to close a meeting.
The Kent County Board consists of five members.
A candidate elected to the county board shall be a resident and registered voter of Kent County. Any member who no longer resides in Kent County may not continue as a member of the board.

paragraph.text: The incumbent members of the Kent County Board who hold office on July 1, 2010 shall hold office until their successors are elected and qualify.
Members of the Kent County Board shall be elected from Kent County at large as follows:

subparagraph.text: Two members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2012 and every 4 years thereafter; and
Three members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2014 and every 4 years thereafter.

paragraph.text: Each member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on January 1 after his election and until a successor is elected and qualifies. The terms of members are staggered and elections shall be held as provided in subsection (c) of this section.

Any vacancy on the county board shall be filled by a qualified individual appointed by the County Commissioners of Kent County to serve until a successor is elected and qualifies at the general election next following the creation of the vacancy and for which the deadline for the filing of candidates has not expired.
An individual may serve for more than 2 consecutive terms.
The State Board may remove a member of the county board for:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against him and give him an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in his own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Kent County.

section.text: At its first meeting at the beginning of each year, the county board shall elect a president and a vice president from among its members.

subsection.text: The chairman of the county board is entitled to receive $2,400 annually as compensation and the other members are entitled to receive $2,000 each annually as compensation.
The chairman and the other members are entitled to the allowances for travel and other expenses provided in the Kent County budget.
The county board shall meet at least once each month.
All actions of the county board shall be taken at a public meeting and a record of the meeting and all actions shall be made public.
This section does not prohibit the county board from meeting and deliberating in executive session provided that all final action is taken at a public meeting.

paragraph.text: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Elected member” means 1 of the 7 elected and voting members of the Montgomery County Board or a member appointed to fill a vacancy of 1 of these 7 members.

“Board of Education District” means a geographic area of Montgomery County in which an elected member of the Montgomery County Board of Education must be a legal resident. The geographic area of each district is described in subsection (f) of this section. Each district shall be substantially equal in population, and the districts shall be reapportioned on the basis of each decennial census of the United States.

subsection.text: The Montgomery County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: 5 elected members, each of whom resides in a different board of education district;
2 elected members who may reside anywhere in the county; and
1 student member.

subsection.text: An elected member of the county board shall be a registered voter of Montgomery County.
Members of the Montgomery County Board shall be elected at the general election every 2 years as required by subsection (f) of this section.

paragraph.text: The student member shall be a bona fide resident of Montgomery County and a regularly enrolled junior or senior year student from a Montgomery County public high school.

The nomination and election process shall be as agreed on by the county board and the Montgomery County region of the Maryland Association of Student Councils. This agreement shall include a process by which to replace one or both of the final candidates if they are unable to proceed in the election. Any student enrolled in a middle or high school in the Montgomery County public schools may:

subparagraph.text: Nominate a student member candidate;
Vote for delegates from the student’s school, who in turn vote in a nominating convention to reduce to 2 the number of candidates for student board member if there are 3 or more candidates; and
Vote directly for 1 of the 2 remaining student board member candidates.

paragraph.text: The candidate receiving the second highest number of votes in the direct election shall become the alternate student member. The alternate shall serve if the student member is unable to complete his elected term.
Except as provided in paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) of this subsection, the student member has the same rights and privileges of an elected member.
Unless invited to attend by the affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session that relates to:

subparagraph.text: Hearings held under § 6–202(a) of this article; or
Collective bargaining.

paragraph.text: As provided in paragraph (7) of this subsection, the student member shall vote on all matters except those relating to:

subparagraph.text: § 6–202(a) of this article;
Collective bargaining;
Capital and operating budgets; and
School closings, reopenings, and boundaries.

paragraph.text: On a majority vote of the elected members, the board may determine, on a case by case basis, whether a matter under consideration is covered by the exclusionary provisions listed in paragraph (6) of this subsection.

Each elected member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on December 1 after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies. The terms of elected members are staggered as required by the terms of the members serving on the county board as of July 1, 1978 so that 4 members are elected in gubernatorial election years and 3 members are elected in presidential election years.
Elected members of the county board shall be elected by the voters of the entire county.

subparagraph.text: Of the 3 members elected in 1992 and every 4 years thereafter, 1 shall reside in Board of Education District 2 and 1 shall reside in Board of Education District 4. The third member may reside in any part of the county.

Of the 4 members elected in 1990 and every 4 years thereafter, 1 shall reside in Board of Education District 1, 1 shall reside in Board of Education District 3, and 1 shall reside in Board of Education District 5. The fourth member may reside in any part of the county.
The descriptions of board of education districts in this subsection refer to the geographical boundaries of the election districts and the precincts:

sub-subparagraph.text: As reviewed and certified by the Montgomery County Board of Elections or its designees, before the precinct boundaries were reported to the U.S. Bureau of the Census as part of the 2010 Census Redistricting Data Program; and

As those precinct lines are specifically shown on the P.L. 94–171 census block maps provided by the U.S. Bureau of the Census and as reviewed and corrected by the Division of Long–range Planning of the Montgomery County Public Schools.

subparagraph.text: Where precincts are split between Board of Education Districts, census tract and block numbers, as indicated in the P.L. 94–171 data or shown on the P.L. 171 census block maps provided by the U.S. Bureau of the Census and referred to in this subtitle, are used to define the boundaries of the education districts.
Board of Education District 1 consists of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Election district 1;
Election district 2, precincts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, and 11;
Election district 3;
Election district 11;
Election district 12;

That part of election district 2, precinct 9 that is generally the western part of precinct 9 which is bounded by Little Seneca Creek to the east, and also generally the far eastern part of precinct 9 from Father Hurley Boulevard east to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 1 that is generally the western part of precinct 1 which extends from the precinct boundary north along South Germantown Tributary (a creek), then east along the center of Schaeffer Road to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 11 that is generally the western part of precinct 11 which extends from the precinct boundary northeast along the center of Schaeffer Road, then runs northwest across the Soccerplex at the intersection of Schaeffer Road and Burdette Lane, then west and north along Hoyles Mill Tributary (a creek), then northeast along Little Seneca Creek to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 1 that is generally the northern part of precinct 1 which extends from the precinct boundary east along the center of CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 8 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 8 which extends from the precinct boundary southeast along the center of Wisteria Drive, then southwest along the center of Great Seneca Highway to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 10 that is generally the northern part of precinct 10 which extends from the precinct boundary northeast along the center of Washington Grove Lane to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 16 that is generally the northern part of precinct 16 which extends from the precinct boundary south along Interstate 270, then east along CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary; and
That part of election district 9, precinct 24 that is generally the northeastern part of precinct 24 which extends from the precinct boundary southeast along Interstate 270 to the precinct boundary.

subparagraph.text: Board of Education District 2 consists of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Election district 2, precinct 2;
Election district 4, precincts 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 14, 16, 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26, and 30;
Election district 6, precincts 3, 4, 5 through 10, 13, and 14;
Election district 9, precincts 2, 3, 6, 13, 14, 26, 27, 31, 33, 35, 36, and 38;
That part of election district 2, precinct 9 that is generally the central part of precinct 9 which is bounded by Little Seneca Creek to the west and Father Hurley Boulevard to the east;

That part of election district 4, precinct 19 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 19 from the precinct boundary at the intersection of Gude Drive and Calhoun Drive running northeast and approximately 200 feet east of Dubuque Court and Grinnell Terrace, then west along Crabbs Branch Tributary (a creek), then north along the center of Ottenbrook Terrace, then northeast along the center of Deer Lake Lane, then east along the center of Deer Lake Road, then west along the center of Needwood Road to the precinct boundary;
That part of election district 4, precinct 20 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 20 which extends from the precinct boundary north along Piney Branch Creek to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 1 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 1 which extends from the precinct boundary north along South Germantown Tributary (a creek), then east along the center of Schaeffer Road to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 11 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 11 which extends from the precinct boundary northeast along the center of Schaeffer Road, then runs northwest across the Soccerplex at the intersection of Schaeffer Road and Burdette Lane, then west and north along Hoyles Mill Tributary (a creek), then northeast along Little Seneca Creek to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 12 that is generally the eastern part of precinct 12 which extends from the precinct boundary north along Sandy Branch Creek, then north along the center of Potomac Riding Lane to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 1 that is generally the southern part of precinct 1 which extends from the precinct boundary east along the center of CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 8 that is generally the western part of precinct 8 which extends from the precinct boundary southeast along the center of Wisteria Drive, then southwest along the center of Great Seneca Highway to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 10 that is generally the southern part of precinct 10 which extends from the precinct boundary northeast along the center of Washington Grove Lane to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 9, precinct 16 that is generally the southern part of precinct 16 which extends from the precinct boundary south along Interstate 270, then east along CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary; and
That part of election district 9, precinct 24 that is generally the southwestern part of precinct 24 which extends from the precinct boundary southeast along Interstate 270 to the precinct boundary.

subparagraph.text: Board of Education District 3 consists of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Election district 4, precincts 4, 8, 10, 12, 13, 17, 18, 27, 28, 31, and 32;
Election district 6, precinct 2;
Election district 7;
Election district 10;
Election district 13, precincts 3, 16, 26, 38, 39, and 65;

That part of election district 4, precinct 15 that is generally the northern part of precinct 15 which extends from the precinct boundary east along the center of Randolph Road to the precinct boundary;
That part of election district 4, precinct 20 that is generally the western part of precinct 20 which extends from the precinct boundary north along Piney Branch Creek to the precinct boundary;

That part of election district 6, precinct 12 that is generally the western part of precinct 12 which extends from the precinct boundary north along Sandy Branch Creek, then north along the center of Potomac Riding Lane to the precinct boundary; and
That part of election district 13, precinct 34 that is generally the southern part of precinct 34 which extends from the precinct boundary east along CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary.

subparagraph.text: Board of Education District 4 consists of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Election district 13, precincts 1, 2, 4 through 15, 17 through 25, 27 through 33, 35, 36, 37, 40 through 45, 47, 48, 50, 53, 55, 56, 57, 58, 59, 62, 63, 66, 67, and 68;

That part of election district 4, precinct 15 that is generally the southern part of precinct 15 which extends from the precinct boundary east along the center of Randolph Road to the precinct boundary; and
That part of election district 13, precinct 34 that is generally the northern part of precinct 34 which extends from the precinct boundary east along CSX railroad tracks to the precinct boundary.

subparagraph.text: Board of Education District 5 consists of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Election district 4, precincts 1, 9, and 34;
Election district 5;
Election district 8;
Election district 13, precincts 46, 49, 51, 52, 54, 61, 64, and 69; and

That part of election district 4, precinct 19 that is generally the western part of precinct 19 from the precinct boundary at the intersection of Gude Drive and Calhoun Drive running northeast and approximately 200 feet east of Dubuque Court and Grinnell Terrace, then west along Crabbs Branch Tributary (a creek), then north along the center of Ottenbrook Terrace, then northeast along the center of Deer Lake Lane, then east along the center of Deer Lake Road, then west along the center of Needwood Road to the precinct boundary.

subparagraph.text: The student member serves for a term of 1 year beginning on July 1 after the election.
The student member shall be replaced for the remainder of the term by the alternate student member if the student member:

sub-subparagraph.text: Resigns or otherwise is unable to complete the term; or
Is removed under the provisions of subsection (g) of this section.

subparagraph.text: The elected members of the county board shall select a student to complete the remainder of the term if the student member is replaced as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph and the alternate member:

sub-subparagraph.text: Resigns or otherwise is unable to complete the term; or
Is removed under the provisions of subsection (g) of this section.

paragraph.text: The remaining members of the county board shall select a qualified individual to fill any vacancy on the elected board for the remainder of that term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, an elected county board member shall forfeit the office if the member fails to reside in the board of education district from which the member was elected.

If the failure to continue to reside in the district is caused by an alteration in the board of education district boundaries because of reapportionment, the member may complete the term for which the member was elected.

In the event of a vacancy caused by a member who is required to reside in a particular board of education district, the person appointed to fill the vacancy shall reside in the same district at the time of appointment and while filling out the unexpired term.

paragraph.text: The Montgomery County Council may remove a member of the county board for:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a member, the County Council shall provide the member a copy of the charges against him and give him an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The County Council promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the County Council sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the County Council in the member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Montgomery County.

subsection.text: An elected member of the county board is entitled to reimbursement for travel and other expenses as provided by the Montgomery County Council.

paragraph.text: An elected member of the county board is entitled to receive $18,500 annually as compensation and the president of the county board is entitled to an additional $4,000 annually as compensation.

An elected member is entitled to health insurance and to other fringe benefits regularly provided to employees of the board of education under the same terms and conditions extended to other employees of the board of education.
The student member may not receive compensation but, after submitting expense vouchers, may be reimbursed for out–of–pocket expenses incurred in connection with official duties.
A student member who completes a full term on the board shall be granted a scholarship of $5,000 to be applied toward the student’s higher education costs.

subsection.text: All actions of the county board shall be taken after a public meeting, the record of which shall be made public.

Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, this section does not prohibit the county board from meeting and deliberating in executive session provided that all action of the board, together with the individual vote of each member, is contained in a public record.

If the county superintendent denies an appeal of a decision by the chief operating officer of the county public schools to add or delete a school bus stop or to eliminate or move a school bus route, the appeal to the county board and the decision on the appeal shall be governed by the following requirements:

paragraph.text: The county board shall hold a public hearing on the matter contained in the appeal;
Members of the public shall be given a reasonable opportunity to testify and present their views at the hearing; and
The board shall make a decision on the appeal in item (1) of this subsection at a public meeting and the individual vote of each member shall be recorded on the public record.

subsection.text: The affirmative vote of the members of the county board for the passage of a motion by the county board shall be:

paragraph.text: 5 members when the student member is voting; or
4 members when the student member is not voting.
The descriptions of school board districts in this section refer to the geographical boundaries of the election districts and precincts:

subparagraph.text: As reviewed and certified by the Prince George’s County Board of Elections or its designees before the precinct boundaries were reported to the U.S. Bureau of the Census as part of the 2010 Census Redistricting Data Program; and
As those precinct lines are specifically shown on the Public Law 94–171 census block maps provided by the U.S. Bureau of the Census and as reviewed and corrected by the Department of Planning.

paragraph.text: Where precincts are split between board of education districts, census tract and block numbers, as indicated in the P.L. 94–171 data or shown on the P.L. 94–171 census block maps provided by the U.S. Bureau of the Census and referred to in this subtitle, are used to define the boundaries of board of education districts.

subsection.text: In this subtitle, “elected member” means a member of the Prince George’s County Board elected from one of the nine school board districts described in § 3–1001 of this subtitle.
The Prince George’s County Board consists of 10 members as follows:

paragraph.text: Nine elected members, each of whom resides in a different school board district; and
One student member selected under subsection (f)(2) of this section.
One member of the county board shall be elected from each of the nine school board districts described in § 3–1001 of this subtitle.
From the time of filing as a candidate for election, each candidate shall be a registered voter of the county and a resident of the school board district the candidate seeks to represent.
An elected county board member shall forfeit the office if the member:

subparagraph.text: Fails to reside in the school board district from which the member was elected, unless this change is caused by a change in the boundaries of the district; or
Fails to be a registered voter of the county.

paragraph.text: A county board member may not hold another office of profit in county government during the member’s term.
Each elected member of the county board shall be nominated by the registered voters of the member’s school board district.

subsection.text: The elected members of the county board shall be elected:

paragraph.text: At the general election every 4 years as required by subsection (g) of this section; and
By the voters of the school board district that each member represents.

If a candidate for the county board dies or withdraws the candidacy during the period beginning with the date of the primary and ending 70 days before the date of the general election, the Board of Elections shall:

subparagraph.text: Replace the name of the deceased or withdrawn candidate on the ballot for the general election with the name of the candidate who received the next highest number of votes in the primary election; or
If a contested primary was not held, reopen the filing process to allow other persons to file as candidates.

Except as otherwise provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the Board of Elections shall add to the ballot for the general election the name of any person who files as a candidate in accordance with paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection.
The Board of Elections may not add additional candidates to the ballot for the general election within 70 days before the date of the election.

paragraph.text: The student member shall be an eleventh or twelfth grade student in the Prince George’s County public school system during the student’s term in office.

An eligible student shall file a nomination form at least 2 weeks before a special election meeting of the Prince George’s Regional Association of Student Governments. Nomination forms shall be made available in the administrative offices of all public senior high schools in the county, the office of student concerns, and the office of the president of the regional association. The delegates to the regional association annually shall elect the student member to the board at a special election meeting to be held each school year.
The student member may vote on all matters before the board except those relating to:

subparagraph.text: Capital and operating budgets;
School closings, reopenings, and boundaries;
Collective bargaining decisions;
Student disciplinary matters;
Teacher and administrator disciplinary matters as provided under § 6–202(a) of this article; and
Other personnel matters.

paragraph.text: On an affirmative vote of a majority of the elected members of the county board, the board may determine if a matter before the board relates to a subject that the student member may not vote on under paragraph (3) of this subsection.

Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the elected members of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session that relates to hearings on appeals of special education placements, hearings held under § 6–202(a) of this article, or collective bargaining.
The Prince George’s Regional Association of Student Governments may establish procedures for the election of the student member of the county board.
The election procedures established by the Prince George’s Regional Association of Student Governments are subject to the approval of the elected members of the county board.

Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, an elected member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on the first Monday in December after the member’s election and until the member’s successor is elected and qualifies.
The terms of the elected members are staggered as follows:

subparagraph.text: The five elected members who received the lowest percentage of votes, as determined by the final vote count of the 2010 General Election as certified by the Board of Elections, shall serve for a term of 2 years; and
The other four members elected in the 2010 General Election shall serve for a term of 4 years.

paragraph.text: The student member serves for a term of 1 year beginning at the end of a school year.

sub-subparagraph.text: A seat on the county board held by an elected member that becomes vacant more than 180 days before the end of that member’s term of office shall be filled for the remainder of the term at a special election.

A seat on the county board held by an elected member that becomes vacant 180 days or less before the end of that member’s term of office shall remain vacant until a successor is elected and qualifies.

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: No later than 7 days after the occurrence of a vacancy on the county board that must be filled at a special election, the County Council shall adopt a resolution directing that a special primary election and special general election be held in the school board district where the vacancy occurs.
The County Council shall consult with the Board of Elections before adopting the resolution.

sub-subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph, the County Council resolution shall specify:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The date by which a certificate of candidacy must be filed with the Board of Elections;
The date of the special primary election; and
The date of the special general election.

sub-subparagraph.text: No later than 7 days after the adoption of the County Council resolution, the Board of Elections shall publish the information contained in the resolution once in at least one newspaper of general circulation.
A candidate shall file a certificate of candidacy with the Board of Elections no later than 28 days before a special primary election in order to appear on the ballot.
The following provisions are subject to subsubparagraph 3 of this subparagraph:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: A special primary election shall be held on a Tuesday at least 45 days but no later than 60 days after the occurrence of a vacancy.
A special general election shall be held on a Tuesday at least 60 days but no later than 90 days after the occurrence of a vacancy.

sub-subparagraph.text: A special election may not be held less than 30 days before a regularly scheduled election.
On the day of a special election, polling places shall be open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

No later than 10 days before a special primary election and special general election, the Board of Elections shall mail a specimen ballot to the household of each registered voter in the school board district where the vacancy occurs.

The specimen ballot shall include the names of the candidates in the order and form in which they are to appear on the ballot, together with a statement, not to exceed 500 words, provided by each candidate.
Prince George’s County shall fund a special election held under this paragraph.

The Board of Elections shall submit a request for a supplemental budget appropriation to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to cover the cost of a special election no later than 60 days after the election.

subparagraph.text: A special election under this paragraph shall be governed by Title 8, Subtitle 8 of the Election Law Article and all other relevant provisions of law relating to the conduct of elections except as otherwise provided in this subtitle or where such construction would be unreasonable.

paragraph.text: With the approval of the Governor, the State Board may remove a member of the county board for any of the following reasons:

subparagraph.text: Immorality;
Misconduct in office;
Incompetency; or
Willful neglect of duty.

paragraph.text: Before removing a member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges pending and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.
If the member requests a hearing within the 10–day period:

subparagraph.text: The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the member a notice of the hearing; and
The member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member’s own defense, in person or by counsel.

paragraph.text: A member removed under this subsection has the right to judicial review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Prince George’s County based on an administrative record and such additional evidence as would be authorized by § 10–222(f) and (g) of the State Government Article.

subsection.text: While serving on the county board, a member may not be a candidate for a public office other than a position on the county board.

paragraph.text: From and after December 4, 2006, at the beginning of each member’s full term, the chair of the county board is entitled to receive $19,000 annually as compensation and the other elected members are each entitled to receive $18,000 annually as compensation.

Each elected member of the county board may be provided health insurance and other fringe benefits regularly provided to employees of the Board of Education under the same terms and conditions extended to other employees of the Board of Education.

After submitting vouchers under the rules and regulations adopted by the county board, the chair and the other members, including the student member, are entitled to the allowances for travel and other expenses provided in the Prince George’s County budget.
A member of the county board may not be reimbursed more than $7,000 in travel and other expenses incurred in a single fiscal year.

subsection.text: The county board shall hold an annual meeting on the first Monday in December to elect a chair and vice chair from among its members.

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the affirmative vote of the members of the county board for the passage of a motion by the county board shall be:

subparagraph.text: Six members when the student member is voting; or
Five members when the student member is not voting.

paragraph.text: When there are two or more vacancies on the county board, the affirmative vote of the members of the county board for the passage of a motion by the board shall be:

subparagraph.text: Five members when the student member is voting; or
Four members when the student member is not voting.

subsection.text: There is a Shared Space Council for Prince George’s County. The purpose of the Council is to consider the alternative use of any vacant public schools and any vacant space that exists in the Prince George’s County public school system.
The Council shall consist of 23 members, appointed as follows:

paragraph.text: One member from each legislative district within Prince George’s County, each of whom shall be appointed by the legislative delegation from the district.
One member from each of the following governmental agencies, departments, or institutions:

subparagraph.text: The staff of the county board of education;
The staff of the County Executive;
The staff of the County Council;
The county Department of Social Services;
The staff of the county Superintendent of Education;
The Prince George’s County Planning Board;
The county Department of Aging;
The county health department;
The county Office of Coordination of Services to the Handicapped;
The county Juvenile Services Administration;
The county Memorial Library System; and
The county Department of Program Planning and Economic Development.

paragraph.text: On a rotating basis, one member shall be from the faculty or administration of Bowie State College or Prince George’s Community College. Such member shall be appointed by the president of the college.
The members from governmental agencies, departments, or institutions shall be appointed by the director, chairman, or chief executive officer of the agency, department, or institution.
Two members shall be appointed by the County Executive.

subsection.text: The term of the members appointed pursuant to subsection (b)(2), (3), and (4) shall be 3 years. All other members shall serve for a term of 2 years. Any vacancy on the Council shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.

The Council shall meet at least four times each year. It shall, on an annual basis and in conjunction with the county board of education, survey the schools within the county public school system and compile a listing of any vacant public schools and any vacant space that exists within the system. The Council shall evaluate the feasibility of using any vacant public school or vacant space for community or governmental purposes.

The Council shall report the results, findings, and recommendations derived from such survey, listing, and evaluation to the county board of education, the County Executive, the County Council and the mayor of each municipality in the county.

section.text: In addition to the powers otherwise granted to the county board in this article, the county board or a designated committee of the county board may hear an appeal from a decision of the county superintendent that relates to the grade, transfer, tuition, or any aspect of participation in a program or activity of a specific student who is not subject to the provisions of Title 8, Subtitle 4 of this article.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in Prince George’s County, the board of education may implement the use of school uniforms by all students in the public schools in the county.

subsection.text: The Queen Anne’s County Board consists of:

paragraph.text: Five voting, nonpartisan, elected members; and
One nonvoting student representative from each public high school in the county.

subsection.text: The five voting, nonpartisan, elected members shall be elected by the voters of the entire county at a general election in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.

subparagraph.text: One voting member shall reside in and be elected from each of the four county commissioner districts; and
One member shall reside in the county and be elected from the county at large.
A member from a county commissioner district who no longer resides in the district may not continue as a member of the county board.
A member at large who no longer resides in the county may not continue as a member of the county board.

paragraph.text: A candidate elected to the county board shall be a registered voter and resident of Queen Anne’s County for at least 3 years.

Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, each elected voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning on the first Monday in December after the member’s election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The initial terms of the elected voting members are staggered as follows:
